intro: Sida decagyna, commonly known as the nine-angled mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with a hairy surface and produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds. Sida decagyna is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to a variety of environmental conditions.
